title: King Boo's Haunted Mansion Lego Mario Set Gets First Price Cut At Amazon
description: One of the coolest Lego Super Mario expansion sets is on sale for the first time at Amazon and Target: King Boo's Haunted Mansion. Released in August for $75 alongside the revamped starter kits for Mario, Luigi, and Peach, the 932-piece expansion kit is discounted to $60. It's one of numerous Lego Super Mario sets in Target's Early Black Friday Sale, which runs through November 9. Amazon is matching this deal and several others as well as offering deals of its own. Get Mario Haunted Mansion Deal at Amazon Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: New Cuphead Limited-Edition Art Book Gets First Discount At Amazon
description: One of the best video game art books just received a sequel. The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course was published by Dark Horse Books on November 5. Cuphead fans have three editions to choose from: a standard hardcover, Deluxe Edition hardcover, and Kindle ebook.And for the first time since going up for preorder a few months back, the Deluxe Edition has received a discount at Amazon, dropping the price to $89 (was $100). You can also get a big discount on The Art of the Cuphead Show, which chronicles the making of wonderful Netflix animated adaptation.The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last CourseStandard edition (Hardcover) -- $36 ($40)Deluxe Edition (Hardcover) -- $88 ($100)Kindle ebook (Digital) -- $24The Art of The Cuphead Show (Hardcover) -- $35 ($50)The Art of Cuphead (Hardcover) -- $30.49 ($50)Just like the original Cuphead art book, this is a stunning companion that beautifully captures the intricate process of animating a game designed to look like a 1930s-era cartoon.This article was originally published last month as an exclusive preview of the first few pages from The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course. Since then, I've looked flipped through the full book in digital format. My takeaway? Cuphead fans are in for a treat. You can check out a handful of pages from the book below to get an idea of what to expect. See all Cuphead books at Amazon The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course Standard EditionThe Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course is a 272-page oversized hardcover focused exclusively on Cuphead's brilliant 2022 DLC (Delicious Last Course). The book takes fans on a frame-by-frame journey through the expansion's seven bosses and The King's Leap challenge arena. Delicious Last Course also introduced Ms. Chalice as a playable character and numerous new NPCs who will likely be featured in this art book.If you've played Cuphead, you know the level of detail on display in each of the game's inventive boss battles. The DLC actually has as many frames of animation as the base game, despite it only comprising about 25% of the full Cuphead experience. The Art of Cuphead, which focuses on the base game, is a fascinating, must-have book for fans, so we'd expect The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course to provide a similarly insightful look inside Studio MDHR's creative process.Along with frame-by-frame animation of the bosses from The Delicious Last Course, the book contains early concept art as well as unused ideas. See at Amazon If you haven't checked out the art book for the base game, you can save about $20 off its list price at Amazon. The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course Deluxe EditionBig Cuphead fans will want to check out The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course Deluxe Edition, a limited release featuring a mint-green foil-stamped slipcase, a fold-out portfolio case with a trio of acetate cells, and a ribbon bookmark.It matches the Deluxe Edition for the base game's art book. Fair warning: The Art of Cuphead Deluxe Edition has only been available to purchase from third-party sellers for years at this point--unlike some video game art books, it truly was "limited edition." If you're interested in the fancy version, you probably don't want to wait too long to place your order.Normally $100, the Deluxe Edition is on sale for $89 at Amazon. See at Amazon Both physical editions have 272 pages, so the preview pages shown below will match your copy of the book when it arrives. Page 12"We knew from the beginning that Ms. Chalice had to stand alongside Cuphead and Mugman as an iconic part of a trio. This meant meticulous iteration on her character expressions, including the existence of an 'evil form--Ms. Malice!" Page 13"Unlike Cuphead and Mugman, Ms. Chalice only takes corporeal form within a level. These character intro concepts from Animation Supervisor Hanna Abi-Hanna illustrate the challenge of capturing Chalice's emergence from the Astral Plane." Page 16"Through Ms. Chalice's animations, we wanted to capture the wide-eyed ingenue that was prototypical of the 1930s cartoon female lead. At the same time, we wanted her movements to imbue her with the sense of grit determination, and impishness common in other characters from the era." Page 17This page shows frame-by-frame animation cells of Ms. Chalice crouching. Page 18"As with Cuphead and Mugman, Ms. Chalice needed her very own 'death ghost'--the sprite which players see after your character has lost their last hit point..." Page 19"Pictured above, the unique frames of Ms. Chalice's death ghost as it floats tearfully off screen, illustrated by Animation Supervisor Hanna Abi-Hanna." The Art of the Cuphead ShowThe Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course is the second new art book on the franchise this year. In September, Dark Horse published The Art of the Cuphead Show, a 256-page hardcover book examining the creation of Netflix's great animated series that ran for three seasons in 2022. We previewed The Art of the Cuphead Show before its publication, so you can check out a few pages from that book.Amazon is selling the hardcover edition of The Art of the Cuphead Show for $35 (was $50). See at Amazon

description: Action-survival roguelike Vampire Survivors is already one of the best deals in gaming. For five bucks, you get an endlessly replayable time sink that’s stuffed with unlockable characters, dozens of weapons to experiment with, and clever secrets to discover. The game’s most recent add-on, Ode to Castlevania, somehow manages to make the original offering feel […]

title: Choose between cyberpunk and magic in Zephon, the new 4X from the Warhammer 40,000 – Gladius devs
description: Warhammer 40,000: Gladius - Relics Of War developers Proxy Studios have just released Zephon, a new 4X strategy game set in a manky, post-apocalyptic world. It's got hexagonal maps, flesh trees, gangly Evangelion-grade giants, "otherworldly hymns of decay", nuclear bombs, and a player-led "blend of magic and cyberpunk" that extends from the city architecture to the research component. All of which is my cup of giblets. Here's the launch trailer. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: The Warframe devs want you to come try their luxurious fantasy action-RPG Soulframe
description: Warframe developers Digital Extremes have announced a new round of early access for their 2025-bound fantasy action-RPG Soulframe, which I saw a bit of last year and think is pretty promising. They're now adding 2000 players to a Preludes build of the game every week, with each invite email including an additional four invite codes, so you can get your friends involved. Read more

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 855
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Last show you binged watched? “The Diplomat” season 2 on Netflix with Keri Russell. It’s a little silly but I like how they weave real things that happen in the world into it. 2. Have you started planning for Thanksgiving yet? Girl, no. LOL! I barely made it through the Halloween season, which honestly felt like it was three years long. I know in a few years, when Connor’s older, I’ll miss all the activities. Anyway, for Thanksgiving, we’re invited to a dinner that a friend is hosting, so we’ll probably do that. Or, we’ll just stay at home in our jammies, watch movies and have a crab fest again. So fun! 3. Pick your fall nail color – red, burgundy or dark blue? Ooh, burgundy please![Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 855 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 836
description: Last year Harris, that dastardly lothario, won the annual Novato pumpkin growing contest, which came as a huge shock to Rosie because she thinks he’s mentally inferior. While that may be true, Harris has figured out how to grow big pumpkins. This year, Rosie isn’t holding back. She’s put a lot of time and scientific work into maximizing her pumpkin yields. She also read a bunch of books on botany and interviewed all the top minds in the field. Hopefully she can reclaim the crown that Tabs once had. 😸 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 836 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
